feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 6:04AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow This Evening Through Monday... Snow is expected to develop this evening and continue through Monday before tapering off Monday night. Snow fall totals are expected to be 2 to 4 inches, with the heaviest amounts north of Fairbanks. This is expected to be a wet and slippery snow. Brief freezing rain is possible this afternoon and evening, and could
entry.cap:areaDesc: Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 7:47PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ICE JAMS WILL CONTINUE IN THE ANCHORAGE BOWL AND MAT-SU VALLEY INTO THE WEEKEND... Recent abnormally cold temperatures have caused ice formation on area rivers and streams across the Anchorage and Mat-Su valleys. This ice formation is causing ice jams, and has led to localized overflow flooding in the vicinity of the jam. Warming weather into
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 13 at 8:33AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The river level at Astor is forecast to hold steady around 4.0 feet into at least midweek as northerly and northeasterly winds opposing flow of the river return. Residents will see Major Flood impacts through at least Wednesday with a decline to Moderate flood forecast
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 13 at 8:28AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at DeLand is forecast to remain relatively steady near 5.2 feet this week as rainfall from Nicole moves through the basin. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Moderate flooding impacts through the foreseeable future.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 13 at 8:25AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to slowly rise through Minor Flood Stage and reach Moderate Flood Stage Late Monday or Tuesday, as rainfall from Nicole moves through the basin. Residents and interests along the river should be prepared for Moderate flood
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 13 at 8:22AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River above Lake Harney will slowly increase to 9.3 feet by Monday as observed rainfall from Nicole moves through the basin. Residents and interests along the river will then continue to see Moderate flooding impacts through this week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued November 13 at 3:54AM PST until November 13 at 9:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility of a quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of the Rouge and Illinois Valleys. This includes Portions of Interstate 5 and Highway 199 as well as the communities of Grants Pass, Selma, Wilderville, Cave Junction, and Obrien.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued November 13 at 3:54AM PST until November 13 at 9:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility of a quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of the Rogue Valley including Medford, Ashland, Phoenix, Talent, Gold Hill, and Rogue River. This also includes portions of Interstate 5. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PST this morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Jackson County

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 13 at 2:23AM PST until November 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM PST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate risk of sneaker waves expected. These are waves that have an unusually higher run up on beaches when compared to other observed waves. * WHERE...Beaches along the Southern Oregon Coast, including the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast

entry.title: Freeze Warning issued November 13 at 3:24AM EST until November 14 at 8:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures with minimum values ranging from 28 to 32 degrees are expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern New Jersey and southeast Pennsylvania.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Delaware; Eastern Montgomery; Lower Bucks; Philadelphia

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued November 13 at 9:28AM AST until November 13 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous surf conditions and rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet. * WHERE...From the northwest to northeast coast of Puerto Rico and Culebra.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Culebra; North Central; Northeast; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity

entry.title: Local Area Emergency issued November 11 at 4:51PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: The following message is transmitted at the request of the McPherson County Sheriff. No travel is advised across McPherson County through the weekend, as roads remain extremely icy following Thursday`s winter storm. Sub- freezing temperatures are forecast through the next several days, so hazardous travel conditions are expected to persist. If you
entry.cap:areaDesc: McPherson

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 4:02AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Winter Weather Expected Across Most of the Panhandles Monday... A vigorous upper level storm system is expected to move just south of the Texas Panhandle on Monday. Precipitation may start off as rain or rain mixed with snow late tonight in the western Panhandles, but will quickly switch over to all snow by sunrise Monday. The snow will then spread across the rest of the

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued November 13 at 2:40AM CST until November 14 at 12:00PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST MONDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Monday.

entry.title: Freeze Warning issued November 13 at 3:58AM EST until November 14 at 9:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures around 28 to 32 degrees expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, northeast, and southern Maryland, The District of Columbia and northern Virginia.

entry.title: Freezing Fog Advisory issued November 13 at 6:23AM PST until November 13 at 11:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in areas of freezing fog. Pockets of visibility 500 feet or less have been observed and should persist for a couple hours after sunrise. * WHERE...In Oregon, Lower Columbia. In Washington, I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 13 at 4:51AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG AND FREEZING FOG THIS MORNING... At 440 AM, areas of dense fog were developing across the valleys of southwest Washington and northwest Oregon, including along portions of Interstate 5. Visibility of one half mile or less has been common in the fog, with localized visibility as low as a couple hundred feet or less. With temperatures near or a little
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Coast
